definition: patient (not impatient)
capable of enduring/able to tolerate/patient/durable/hardy/resistant
to feel vexed/to bother/to trouble/superfluous and confusing/edgy
impatience/impatient
to be tired of living/(coll.) to be asking for trouble

sentences.english: I couldn't wait any longer for you. I had to go.
sentences.chinese: 我等你等得不耐煩了，我已經離開了。

sentences.english: He has a keen impatience with the dull.
sentences.chinese: 他對於遲鈍的人極不耐煩。

sentences.english: The children are itching for the film to begin.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們不耐煩地等着電影開映。

sentences.english: They are chafing at the continuing delays of the buses.
sentences.chinese: 他們因公共汽車連續晚點而不耐煩。

sentences.english: Is doing his homework when also showed an impatient appearance.
sentences.chinese: 就是做作業時也表現出一種不耐煩的樣子。

sentences.english: The fellow shook his head irritably.
sentences.chinese: 那個傢伙不耐煩地搖了搖頭。

sentences.english: Afterwards, Ao patient about aunt and monica a pile.
sentences.chinese: 事後，伯母和萊媼耐煩談了一大堆。
太太不耐煩地嚷起來了。

sentences.english: He doesn't have tenure, so he tends to be a bit edgier.
sentences.chinese: 他沒有終身職位，所以他有不耐煩的傾向。

sentences.english: He complained in a querulous voice about having been woken up.
sentences.chinese: 他用不耐煩的聲音埋怨別人吵醒了他。

sentences.english: She impatiently turned down my request.
sentences.chinese: 她不耐煩地拒絕了我的請求。

sentences.english: I told you I did,' he replied impatiently.
sentences.chinese: “我已經告訴了你我願意，”他不耐煩地回答說。

sentences.english: The master sub- eyebrows a wrinkly, some impatient Nu minds.
sentences.chinese: 老爺子眉頭一皺，有些不耐煩的怒意。

sentences.english: I turn on the engine impatiently. I’m fiddling with the radio when I hear something.
sentences.chinese: 我不耐煩地開着發動機，調試電臺聽着一些東西。

sentences.english: See the sisters with Mao to make trouble, very impatient.
sentences.chinese: 皓月見毛氏姐妹跟來搗亂，非常不耐煩。

sentences.english: He went back to the lab", Iris exclaimed impatiently."
sentences.chinese: “他回實驗室去了，”艾里斯不耐煩地大聲說。

to feel grateful to sb/to appreciate the kindness
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
to blame/to rebuke
to reply
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
to act willfully and make a scene/to make trouble
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
to do what one is told/obedient
to expend a great deal of effort
to recognize people (of babies)/to be able to tell people apart
resentful/angry/to enrage sb
to reply
to enumerate sb's shortcomings/to criticize/to scold/to talk on and on
sincere/solid
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
